grocerystoresimulator

Class CheckOut

  • java.lang.Object
    • grocerystoresimulator.CheckOut

  • public class CheckOut
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CheckOut()
      Creates a checkout object that can be used for manipulating store lines.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Customer name)
      Adds a customer to the store to shop until they are moved to a checkout line based on their priority in the queue.
      int expressLength()
      Shows how long the express lane is.
      java.lang.String getLine()
      Gets the string regarding who was moved to which line depending on the moveToCheckout() method.
      void moveToCheckOut()
      Moves a customer to a checkout line based on the items they have and or if the lane is empty or not.
      Customer peekExpress()
      Gets the highest priority/first customer in the express lane queue.
      Customer peekShopping()
      Gets the highest priority/first customer in the currently shopping queue.
      Customer peekStandard()
      Gets the highest priority/first customer in the standard lane.
      void removeFromExpress()
      Removes a customer from the express lane after they have "checked out".
      void removeFromStandard()
      Removes a customer from the standard lane after they have "checked out".
      java.lang.String showExpress()
      Shows who is currently in the express lane and how many items they have.
      java.lang.String showShopping()
      Shows the customers still shopping in the store and how many items they are shopping for.
      java.lang.String showStandard()
      Shows who is currently in the standard lane and how many items they have.
      int standardLength()
      Shows how long the standard lane is.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Customer name)
        Adds a customer to the store to shop until they are moved to a checkout line based on their priority in the queue.
        Parameters:
        name - The customer added to the store.

      • moveToCheckOut

        public void moveToCheckOut()
                    throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Moves a customer to a checkout line based on the items they have and or if the lane is empty or not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Thrown if the customer does not fit any of the criteria for being moved to a line.

      • removeFromExpress

        public void removeFromExpress()
        Removes a customer from the express lane after they have "checked out".

      • removeFromStandard

        public void removeFromStandard()
        Removes a customer from the standard lane after they have "checked out".

      • showExpress

        public java.lang.String showExpress()
        Shows who is currently in the express lane and how many items they have.
        Returns:
        The names and the number of items of the customers currently occupying the lane.

      • showStandard

        public java.lang.String showStandard()
        Shows who is currently in the standard lane and how many items they have.
        Returns:
        The names of the customers and the number of items they have that currently occupy that lane.

      • showShopping

        public java.lang.String showShopping()
        Shows the customers still shopping in the store and how many items they are shopping for.
        Returns:
        The customers still shopping and how many items they want.

      • expressLength

        public int expressLength()
        Shows how long the express lane is.
        Returns:
        The length of the express lane in integer form.

      • standardLength

        public int standardLength()
        Shows how long the standard lane is.
        Returns:
        The length of the standard lane in integer form.

      • peekShopping

        public Customer peekShopping()
        Gets the highest priority/first customer in the currently shopping queue.
        Returns:
        The name and number of items the customer wants.

      • peekExpress

        public Customer peekExpress()
        Gets the highest priority/first customer in the express lane queue.
        Returns:
        The name and number of items the customer wants.

      • peekStandard

        public Customer peekStandard()
        Gets the highest priority/first customer in the standard lane.
        Returns:
        The name and number of items the customer wants.

      • getLine

        public java.lang.String getLine()
        Gets the string regarding who was moved to which line depending on the moveToCheckout() method.
        Returns:
        The String saying who was moved to which lane.
